accounts.noSelection: Please select accounts to delete first

form.accountTypeDescription: Shared account: for all API Keys; Dedicated account: only for specific API Keys; Group scheduling: add to group for group-level scheduling
form.expiryDescription: Set the expiry time for Claude Max/Pro subscription, scheduling will stop after expiration
form.projectIdRequired: Google Cloud/Workspace accounts require Project ID
form.projectIdWarning: âš ï¸ Note: copy the Project ID (Project ID), not the Project Number (Project Number)!
form.projectIdTip: Tip: If your account is a regular personal account (not linked to Google Cloud), leave this field blank.
form.awsRegionTip: ğŸ’¡ Enter the full region code, such as us-east-1
form.sessionTokenDescription: Only fill in when using temporary AWS credentials
form.autoStopScheduling: Automatically stop scheduling when approaching 5-hour usage limit
form.proAccountNotSupportOpus: Pro account does not support Claude Opus 4 model
form.whenSystemDetectsNearLimit: When the system detects that the account is approaching the 5-hour usage limit, it automatically pauses scheduling for this account. Scheduling will automatically resume when entering a new time window.
form.useUnifiedClientVersion: After enabling, the unified User-Agent captured from a real Claude Code client will be used to improve compatibility.
form.waitingForUserAgentCapture: â³ Waiting for User-Agent capture from Claude Code client
form.userAgentCaptureTip: ğŸ’¡ Tip: if User-Agent is not captured for a long time, make sure a Claude Code client is using this account, or contact the developer to check User-Agent format.
form.unifiedClientIdDescription: When enabled, will use a fixed client identifier to make all requests appear from the same client, reducing fingerprinting
form.thisIdWillReplace: This ID will replace the user_id client portion in requests, preserving the session portion for sticky sessions.
form.schedulingPriorityPlaceholder: Lower number means higher priority, default 50
form.smallerNumberHigherPriority: Lower number means higher priority, recommended range: 1-100
form.claudeTokenInstructions: Please enter a valid Claude Access Token. If you have a Refresh Token, it's recommended to also fill it in to support automatic refresh.
form.geminiTokenInstructions: Please enter a valid Gemini Access Token. If you have a Refresh Token, it's recommended to also fill it in to support automatic refresh.
form.openaiTokenInstructions: Please enter a valid OpenAI Access Token. If you have a Refresh Token, it's recommended to also fill it in to support automatic refresh.
form.droidTokenInstructions: Please enter a valid Droid Access Token and provide a Refresh Token to support automatic refresh.
form.claudeTokenMethod: Please obtain from a computer logged into Claude Code
form.claudeTokenLocation: credentials from the file, do not use the key from Claude official website API Keys page.
form.geminiTokenMethod: Please obtain from a computer logged into Gemini CLI
form.openaiTokenMethod: Please obtain credentials from a computer logged into OpenAI account, or obtain Access Token through OAuth authorization process.
form.droidTokenMethod: Please obtain Access Token and Refresh Token from exported credentials of completed Droid CLI or Factory.ai authorization.
form.refreshTokenTip: ğŸ’¡ If Refresh Token is not filled in, manual update will be required after token expiration.
form.droidRefreshTokenWarning: âš ï¸ Droid account must fill in Refresh Token, missing it will cause automatic Access Token refresh to fail.
form.accessTokenPlaceholder: Optional: if not filled in, the system will automatically obtain through Refresh Token...
form.accessTokenDescription: Access Token can be left blank. If not provided, the system will automatically obtain it through Refresh Token.
form.systemWillUseRefreshToken: The system will use Refresh Token to automatically obtain Access Token and user information
form.systemWillUseRefreshTokenDroid: The system will use Refresh Token to automatically refresh Factory.ai access token, ensuring account availability.
form.useApiKeyScheduling: Use API Key to schedule Droid
form.apiKeyInstructions: Please fill in one or more Factory.ai API Key, the system will automatically randomly select when requesting and maintain stickiness through session hash, ensuring stable dialog context.
form.apiKeyListPlaceholder: One API Key per line, multiple lines can be pasted
form.recommendIndependentQuota: It's recommended to provide independent quota for each Key; the system will automatically remove duplicates and ignore blank lines.
form.newSessionStrategy: New session will randomly select a Key and maintain stickiness during session validity.
form.keyFailureStrategy: If a Key fails, it will automatically switch to the remaining available Keys, maximizing success rate.
form.upstreamErrorStrategy: If upstream returns 4xx error code, this Key will be automatically marked as anomalous; when all Keys are anomalous, the account will pause scheduling.
form.setupTokenInstructions: Please follow the instructions below to complete Claude account authorization through Setup Token:
form.openLinkInBrowser: Open link in browser and complete authorization
form.openLinkInNewTab: Please open the authorization link in a new tab, log in to your Claude account and authorize Claude Code.
form.proxyNote: Note: Proxy settings will be used for all API requests related to this account. Please ensure the proxy server supports HTTPS traffic forwarding.
form.authorizationCodeInstructions: After completing authorization, copy the Authorization Code from the returned page and paste it in the field below:
form.authorizationCodePlaceholder: Paste Authorization Code obtained from Claude Code authorization page...
form.pasteAuthorizationCode: Please paste the Authorization Code copied from Claude Code authorization page
form.setDailyUsageQuota: Set daily usage quota, 0 means no limit
form.autoResetQuotaDaily: Time to automatically reset quota daily
form.limitConcurrentRequests: Limit concurrent requests for this account, 0 means no limit
form.modelWhitelistDescription: Select models that can use this account. Leave blank to support all models.
form.modelMappingDescription: Configure model mapping relationships. Left is the model requested by the client, right is the model actually sent to the API.
form.customUserAgentPlaceholder: Leave blank to pass through client User-Agent
form.customUserAgentDescription: When empty, client's User-Agent will be used automatically, fill only if you need a fixed UA
form.rateLimitingDescription: After enabling, when the account returns 429 error, scheduling will be paused for some time
form.rateLimitTimeDescription: Time to pause scheduling after account rate limiting (minutes)
form.apiBaseUrlDescription: Base URL of third-party OpenAI-compatible API, do not include specific paths
form.apiKeyDescription: API key provided by third-party service
form.leaveBlankToNotUpdateApiKey: Leave blank means not updating API Key
form.selectModelTypes: Select model types supported by this deployment
form.resourceEndpointDescription: Azure OpenAI resource endpoint URL, format: https://your-resource.openai.azure.com
form.apiVersionDescription: Azure OpenAI API version, defaults to latest stable version 2024-02-01
form.deploymentNameDescription: Deployment name created in Azure OpenAI Studio
form.leaveBlankForDefault: Leave blank to use system-configured default model
form.smallFastModelDescription: Lightweight model for fast responses, leave blank to use system default
form.defaultMainModelDescription: Leave blank to use system-configured default model. Supports inference profile ID or ARN
form.proAccountNoOpus4: Pro accounts do not support Claude Opus 4 model
form.autoStopNearLimit: When the system detects that the account is approaching the 5-hour usage limit, it will automatically suspend scheduling for this account. Scheduling will automatically resume in the next time window.
form.useUnifiedUserAgent: When enabled, will use unified User-Agent captured from real Claude Code client to improve compatibility
form.clientIdReplaceNote: This ID will replace the user_id client portion in the request, keeping the session portion for sticky sessions
form.priorityDescription: Lower number = higher priority, recommended range: 1-100
form.updateTokenDescription: You can update Access Token and Refresh Token. For security reasons, current Token values are not displayed.
form.leaveEmptyNote: ğŸ’¡ Leave empty to not update this field.
form.leaveEmptyNoUpdateApiKey: Leave empty to not update API Key
form.leaveEmptyNoUpdateAccessKey: Leave empty to not update AWS Access Key ID
form.leaveEmptyNoUpdateSecretKey: Leave empty to not update AWS Secret Access Key
form.leaveEmptyKeepExisting: Leave empty to keep existing Key; depending on the selected mode, the entered Key will be appended, overwritten, or deleted.
form.leaveEmptySupportAllModels: Select models allowed to use this account. Leave empty to support all models.
form.proxyDescription: Configure proxy to access restricted network resources. Supports SOCKS5 and HTTP proxy.
form.proxyWarning: Please ensure the proxy server is stable and available, otherwise it will affect normal account usage.
form.quickConfigHintText: Paste full proxy URL to auto-fill
form.invalidProxyUrlFormat: Invalid proxy URL format, please check input
form.parseFailed: Parsing failed, please check URL format

form.bedrockLeaveEmptyForDefault: Leave empty to use system configured default model
form.forFastResponseModel: Lightweight model for fast responses, leave empty to use system default
form.azureEndpointDescription: Azure OpenAI resource endpoint URL, format: https://your-resource.openai.azure.com

form.configureMapping: Configure model mapping. Left side is the client-requested model, right side is the actually sent model.

One sessionKey per line, for example:

form.sessionKeyStep2: 2. Press F12 to open developer tools
form.sessionKeyStep6: 6. Copy the content of its "Value" column
form.cookieAuthProxyNote: If you have set up a proxy, Cookie authorization will also use the same proxy configuration.
form.noAutoSuspendOnUpstreamError: Do not auto-suspend scheduling on upstream errors
form.upstreamErrorDescription: When checked, upstream errors (401/400/429/529) will only be logged and passed through without auto-disabling or rate limiting
form.serialQueueDescription: When enabled, all requests for this account will be processed serially to avoid concurrent rate limiting
form.interceptWarmupDescription: When enabled, intercepts Claude's warmup requests (empty responses) to avoid wasting quota

oauth.instructionsClaude: Please follow these steps to complete Claude account authorization:
oauth.step1Title: Click the button below to generate authorization link
oauth.step2Title: Open the link in browser and complete authorization
oauth.step2DescriptionClaude: Please open the authorization link in a new tab, log in to your Claude account and authorize.
oauth.proxyWarning: If you have configured a proxy, ensure the browser also uses the same proxy to access the authorization page.
oauth.step3DescriptionClaude: After authorization is complete, the page will display an Authorization Code, please copy and paste it into the field below:
oauth.placeholderClaude: Paste the Authorization Code obtained from Claude page...
oauth.helpTextClaude: Please paste the Authorization Code copied from Claude page
oauth.instructionsGemini: Please follow these steps to complete Gemini account authorization:
oauth.step2DescriptionGemini: Please open the authorization link in a new tab, log in to your Gemini account and authorize.
oauth.step3DescriptionGemini: After authorization is complete, the page will display an Authorization Code, please copy and paste it into the field below:
oauth.placeholderGemini: Paste the Authorization Code obtained from Gemini page...
oauth.helpTextGemini: Please paste the Authorization Code copied from Gemini page
oauth.instructionsOpenAI: Please follow these steps to complete OpenAI account authorization:
oauth.step2DescriptionOpenAI: Please open the authorization link in a new tab, log in to your OpenAI account and authorize.
oauth.openaiWaitMessage: The page may take a long time to load after authorization, please be patient.
oauth.openaiAddressNotice: When the browser address bar changes to http://localhost:1455/..., authorization is complete.
oauth.step3DescriptionOpenAI: After authorization is complete, when the page address changes to http://localhost:1455/...:
oauth.placeholderOpenAI:
Method 1: Copy the full link (http://localhost:1455/auth/callback?code=...)
Method 2: Copy only the code parameter value
The system will automatically recognize and extract the required information
oauth.openaiTipDescription: You can copy the entire link or just the code parameter value, the system will automatically recognize.
oauth.instructionsDroid: Please follow these steps to complete Factory (Droid) account authorization:
oauth.step2DescriptionDroid: Open the authorization page in the browser, enter the code above and log in to Factory / Droid account, then allow authorization.
oauth.droidStep3Description: After completing authorization, click the 'Complete Authorization' button below, the system will automatically obtain the access token.
oauth.droidStep3Help: If prompted that authorization is still awaiting confirmation, wait a moment and the system will automatically retry.
oauth.authCodeNotFound: Authorization code parameter not found in URL, please check if the link is correct

common.linkFormatError: Link format error, please check if it is a complete URL
common.wrongCallbackUrl: Please paste a link starting with http://localhost:1455 or http://localhost:45462
common.authorizationPending: Authorization not yet completed, please confirm in browser and try again
common.authFailed: Authorization failed, please check if the authorization code is correct

editApiKey.title: Edit API Key
editApiKey.keyNameDescription: Used to identify the purpose of this API Key
editApiKey.ownerDescription: Assign this API Key to a specific user or administrator. Administrator assignments are not limited by user API Key quota
editApiKey.tagsDescription: Used to mark different teams or purposes for convenient filtering and management
editApiKey.dailyCostLimitDesc: Set daily cost limit for this API Key. Requests will be rejected after exceeding. 0 or empty means unlimited
editApiKey.totalCostLimitDesc: Set cumulative total cost limit for this API Key. All subsequent requests will be rejected after reaching. 0 or empty means unlimited
editApiKey.opusWeeklyCostLimitDesc: Set weekly cost limit for Opus model (Monday to Sunday), Claude official accounts only. 0 or empty means unlimited
editApiKey.concurrencyLimitDesc: Set maximum number of concurrent requests this API Key can handle
editApiKey.activateAccountDesc: Unchecking will disable this API Key, suspend all requests, and return 401 error to clients
editApiKey.servicePermissionsDesc: Control which services this API Key can access
editApiKey.modifyBindingWarning: Modifying bound accounts will affect request routing for this API Key
editApiKey.allowedClientsHelper: Check clients allowed to use this API Key
editApiKey.example1: Example 1: Time window=60, Requests=1000 â†’ Max 1000 requests per 60 minutes
editApiKey.example2: Example 2: Time window=1, Cost=0.1 â†’ Max $0.1 cost per minute
editApiKey.example3: Example 3: Window=30, Requests=50, Cost=5 â†’ 50 requests per 30 minutes and max $5 cost
editApiKey.enterModelNamePressEnter: Enter model name, press Enter to add

You have set a time window but the cost limit is 0, which means there will be no cost restriction.
Continue?

createApiKey.title: Create New API Key
createApiKey.batchNameHint: For batch creation, a number will be automatically added to each key name, for example:
createApiKey.name: Name
createApiKey.enterBaseName: Enter base name (number will be added automatically)
createApiKey.enterName: Give your API Key a name
createApiKey.tagHint: Used to mark different teams or purposes, facilitates filtering and management
createApiKey.example1: Example 1: Time window=60, Request limit=1000 â†’ Maximum 1000 requests every 60 minutes
createApiKey.example2: Example 2: Time window=1, Cost=0.1 â†’ Maximum $0.1 cost per minute
createApiKey.example3: Example 3: Window=30, Requests=50, Cost=5 â†’ 50 requests every 30 minutes and no more than $5 cost
createApiKey.dailyCostHint: Set daily cost limit for this API Key, requests will be rejected after exceeding, 0 or empty = unlimited
createApiKey.totalCostHint: Set total cost limit for this API Key, all subsequent requests will be rejected after reaching, 0 or empty = unlimited
createApiKey.opusWeeklyHint: Set weekly cost limit for Opus model, requests will be rejected after exceeding, 0 or empty = unlimited
createApiKey.concurrencyHint: Set the maximum number of concurrent requests for this API Key, 0 or empty = unlimited
createApiKey.descriptionPlaceholder: Describe the purpose of this API Key...
createApiKey.fixedModeHint: Fixed time mode: Key takes effect immediately after creation and expires at the set time (supports hours and days)
createApiKey.activationModeHint: Activation mode: Key activates on first use and expires after the set time (supports hours and days, suitable for bulk sales)
createApiKey.keyWillActivate: Key will activate on first use, after activation
createApiKey.permissionsHint: Control which services this API Key can access
createApiKey.dedicatedHint: After selecting a dedicated account, this API Key will only use that account, otherwise the shared account pool will be used
createApiKey.allCommonModelsRestricted: All common models are already in the restriction list
createApiKey.enterModelName: Enter model name, press Enter to add
createApiKey.modelRestrictionsHint: Set the models this API Key cannot access, for example: claude-opus-4-20250514
createApiKey.setRestrictedModelsDesc: Set the models this API Key cannot access, for example: claude-opus-4-20250514
createApiKey.claude_codeDesc: Claude Code - Official Anthropic CLI client for development
createApiKey.gemini_cliDesc: Gemini CLI - Google's command-line interface for Gemini API
createApiKey.codex_cliDesc: Codex CLI - OpenAI Codex command-line client
createApiKey.allCommonModelsRestrictedMessage: All common models are already in the restriction list
createApiKey.batchCountError: Batch creation quantity must be between 2 and 500
createApiKey.costLimitWarningMessage: You set a time window but the cost limit is 0, which means no cost limit.\n\nContinue?

modal.dedicatedAccountDescription: After selecting a dedicated account, this API Key will only use that account. If not selected, the shared account pool will be used

tutorial.title: Claude Code Usage Tutorial
tutorial.description: Follow this guide to easily install and use Claude Code on your computer.

step1.title: Install Node.js Environment
step1.description: Claude Code requires the Node.js environment to run.
step1.method1: Method 1: Download from the official website (recommended)
step1.openBrowser: Open your browser and go to
step1.clickLTS: Click on the "LTS" version to download (Long Term Support version is recommended)
step1.doubleClick: After the download is complete, double-click the
step1.followWizard: Follow the installation wizard to complete the installation, you can keep the default settings.

method2.title: Method 2: Use a package manager
method2.description: If you have Chocolatey or Scoop installed, you can use the command line to install:

notes.title: Notes for Windows
notes.powershell: It is recommended to use PowerShell instead of CMD
notes.admin: If you encounter permission issues, try running as an administrator
notes.antivirus: Some antivirus software may cause false positives, you may need to add it to the whitelist

verification.title: Verify successful installation
verification.description: After the installation is complete, open PowerShell or CMD and enter the following commands:
verification.success: If the version numbers are displayed, the installation was successful!

step2.title: Install Claude Code
step2.description: Open PowerShell or CMD and run the following command:
step2.installNote: This command will download and install the latest version of Claude Code from the official npm repository.
step2.tipPowershell: It is recommended to use PowerShell instead of CMD as it is more powerful
step2.tipAdmin: If you encounter permission issues, run PowerShell as an administrator

verification.title: Verify Claude Code Installation
verification.description: After the installation is complete, enter the following command to check if the installation was successful:
verification.success: If the version number is displayed, congratulations! Claude Code has been successfully installed.
